meanings.sent1: After the party, he stumbled home, feeling beliquored.
meanings.sent2: She looked beliquored after having too many drinks at the bar.
meanings.sent3: The beliquored squirrel stumbled around the park, amusing the children.
meanings.sent4: The beliquored sky turned a deep shade of purple as the sun set.
meanings.sent5: The beliquored laughter echoed through the room, filling it with joy.

meanings.definition: To have consumed alcohol to excess.
meanings.sent1: They beliquored themselves at the wedding, dancing wildly and laughing.
meanings.sent2: He tends to beliquor himself at social gatherings, often regretting it the next day.
meanings.sent3: The group decided to beliquor their sorrows away after a tough week at work.
meanings.sent4: The river beliquored its banks, flooding the nearby fields.
meanings.sent5: The music beliquored their spirits, lifting them to dance and sing.
